textBeforeTable: Flat view Next unread Next Previous First Parent Forum Complain Reply   Reply with quote   I disagree.  I've always used "auto" with great results.  Gloss optimizer goes just beyond the image area on the paper.  "full" is a waste of "ink". Yes but to get a trully even gloss surface on your entire print it has to be set to full. Or some areas of the image will recieve more GLOP and some less. jtoolman wrote: Nov 12, 2012 jtoolman, In reply to
